Lutz was later honored as “Righteous Among the Nations” by Yad Vashem, the World Holocaust Remembrance Center in Israel. 5/7

There were heroes in Hungary during the Holocaust. Carl Lutz, a Swiss diplomat, is credited with saving thousands of Jewish lives, at times plucking them out of Nazi marching columns to bring them back to safety.  4/7 [Photo courtesy of Fortepan]
60 iron shoes were installed as a memorial to those who perished during the Holocaust and a permanent reminder of the horrors of hate. 3/7
Here is the “Shoes on the Danube Bank” memorial. The location where Nazis lined up Jews and asked them to remove their shoes before shooting them and throwing their bodies into the Danube River. 2/7

The bill is narrowly focused — it would grandfather the Air National Guard’s current space missions into a Space National Guard, meaning limited start-up costs. I look forward to pushing this legislation forward to uplift Colorado's families and support critical defense needs.

Establishing a Space National Guard would improve communication, support personnel, and maintain our critical space capabilities. Space dominance is vital to our national security, but housing these critical capabilities within the Air National Guard is not a long-term solution.

Colorado is home to over one third of all space-related National Guardsmen, and we must make sure we’re doing right by them and their families. That’s why today @RepDLamborn and I introduced legislation to create a Space National Guard.
